introText: The Ministry of Indigenous Affairs works to strengthen relationships with Indigenous communities, supporting reconciliation and addressing Indigenous priorities across Ontario.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Indigenous Affairs spent $145M in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.1% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports Indigenous communities and reconciliation efforts.
roleText: Reconciliation with Indigenous peoples is a fundamental priority for Ontario. This ministry works to build respectful relationships, support Indigenous self-determination, and address historical injustices through partnerships and programs.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Indigenous Affairs operates programs including Indigenous economic development, land claim settlements, community negotiations support, reconciliation initiatives, and capacity building funding.
